availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William W. Nisbet (Hopkins County, KY, farm laborer )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farm laborer. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel B. Nisbet and Agnes Pritchett Nisbet. Student in Hopkins County in 1850. Household owned nine enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Farm laborer in Hopkins County in 1860. Household owned ten enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860. Clerk in Muhlenberg County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 103B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 700-1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 632.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 211A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Muhlenberg County, KY, July 1863, p. 495.
"William Waller Nisbet (1836-1911)," Find A Grave, Memorial #117944453, accessed July 29, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/117944453.
